result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devon Vaughn Pagan

records.addlTxt: Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 12 months

1:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon Vaughn Pagan appeared by video.  Attorney Anthony John Jurek appeared by video for Devon Vaughn Pagan. 
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 
Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 2.  Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 12 months with conditions.
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Jurek agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea. 
 Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea on Count 2; approves the 12 month DPA with conditions.
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.
Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 12 months

2:01 PM Defendant Devon Vaughn Pagan appeared by phone.  Attorney Cliff Burdon appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Anthony John Jurek appeared by video for Devon Vaughn Pagan. 
Atty Jurek has discovery and needs to speak to his client.  

BY THE COURT:  Set another status
Status hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on May 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
for Extension of Time to File Motions to Suppress
Status hearing on April 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is to contact Booking at 608-297-3053 and schedule a time to complete booking within the next 30 days.  Booking is done on Tuesday's on the 2nd floor of the Courthouse.  **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

10:46 AM Attorney Anthony John Jurek appeared by video means for Defendant Devon Vaughn Pagan. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Jurek received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Juech request signature bond with conditions.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $500 signature bond with conditions.
BY THE COURT: Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes  Status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Payable Number: 73912,
Receipt Number: 22R 000812,
Amount: $20.00
